Articles.Content:
Many kinds of craft need this:  VTOL's in hovering mode vs flying mode, spacecraft in flight vs docking mode, rover + skycrane, etc, etc.  It'd be nice to be able to switch your control POV before you hit the freaking ground -- and would be nice to have a way to do it from inside a cockpit.  Letting us put the 'control from here' option in a control group would let us do both.

It'd also fix the odd rocket that wants to 'control from' undeground for no apparent reason.  Just put 'control from here' in stage and it restores on launch and fixes PoV changes that might be caused by a change in stage.

Edited September 18, 2016 by Corona688
This, please. Control from Here desperately lacks another way of activating itself.
Good idea.
Oh god yes
Yes, please please make the control-from-here command available as an action group. I was hoping for this every update patch. Would be greatly appreciated, and about time too, really.

Adding my vote here.
 And asking if there's a mod that does this.

Yesterday, for several hours I struggled with a VTOL plane that despite having the lifting rotors right where it should, and above the center of mass, as soon as it gained the least amount of tilt, would immediately flip over, any attempts to right it 'seemingly' making it worse. Why 'seemingly' in quotes? Because they actually did make it worse!

Disabling gimbal on the lifting engines alleviated the issue.

Adding a probe core oriented up, and switching to it before hover (while leaving gimbal active) removed it entirely.

The game assumes the engines are oriented backwards; that if the craft is to pitch up, turning them 'up' will help. With VTOL it makes them turn forward, doing the exact opposite of what is needed. The same for pitch down; trying to fix a roll made the craft pivot (yaw) and attempt to change heading entered it into a roll.

Adding 'control from here' to the action group for these engines would be a solution.

Yes please. I've been bimbling around Moho for hours with a rover that switches its control point back to vertical every time I go to the map view to see where I am, and the probe core isn't very easy to click (because I didn't expect to have to do it repeatedly).

Additional; please remember the last 'control from here' and keep it that way until the player changes it. No external force should be able to change the control point.

You are doing Kraken's work with this post, OP.

That would be a wonderful option
All the likes. All the likes for this suggestion.
This would be very useful. Good suggestion.
Yes. More generally anything controllable from right-click menus should be available to the action groups.

Wow, this is the first suggestion thread I've seen with absolutely no dissention whatsoever -- zero, nada, zilch.  Usually there's good points for and against.

Is this feature practical to implement, Squad?

Another situation where quick switch of "control from here" would be useful:  When you want the pilot to hold a severe angle above prograde, for example, when re-entering a spaceplane.  You can "control from" a docking port rotated to the proper angle for re-entry, then switch back for normal flight.

Control-from-here is very difficult to find when you need it in the 1.2 prerelease because of all the new controls added to the right-click menu.
